md.name: Markdown Formatting
md.prompt: Format responses using modern Markdown (.md) syntax, utilizing advanced features like tables, lists, callouts, code blocks, and emojis to enhance readability and structure.
md.description: A lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using plain text syntax. Supports features like headers, lists, tables, code blocks, task lists, emojis, and more. Ideal for documentation, READMEs, and structured communication.

examples.name: task list
when: Task 1 and 3 are complete; Task 2 is pending
instead: Task lists use `- [ ]` for incomplete and `- [x]` for complete items.

examples.name: color reference
instead: Use backticks to highlight color codes (HEX/RGB/HSL).

yaml.name: YAML Formatting
yaml.prompt: Format responses using YAML syntax with strict indentation, comments, and human-readable structures. Use features like anchors, lists, and multi-line strings.
yaml.description: A human-friendly data serialization standard for configuration files and structured data. Relies on indentation, colons, and dashes. Supports comments and reusable anchors.

examples.name: basic structure
instead: YAML uses colons with space for key-value pairs. No curly braces or commas required.

examples.name: nested list
instead: Use hyphens and indentation for lists instead of square brackets.

examples.name: multi-line string
instead: Use `|` for literal multi-line strings with preserved newlines.

examples.name: anchor/reference
when:
server: &defaults
  env: prod
web_server:
  env: prod
instead: Use `&` to create anchors and `*` to reference them for reusability.

jsonc.name: JSONC Formatting (JSON with Comments)
jsonc.prompt: Format responses using JSON syntax with // or /* */ comments for explanations. Maintain strict JSON structure while allowing documentation.
jsonc.description: JSON superset that supports comments. Used in configuration files where documentation is required. Not valid standard JSON.

examples.name: inline comment
instead: Use `//` for line comments or `/* */` for block comments.

examples.name: trailing comma
instead: JSONC allows trailing commas ONLY within comments. Avoid them in data.

examples.name: commented config
instead: Add context via comments while maintaining valid JSON structure.
